Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll

Class CourseRoll

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll.CourseRoll
public class CourseRoll extends Object
Represents the roll of students in a Course. Has a minimum and maximum Course size, a list of Student objects, and a capacity of students for this specific Course. Students can be enrolled or dropped, and the number of open seats can be accessed.
Author:
Joey Hughes, Sam McDonald, Winston Cheaz, Warren Long

    • waitlist

      private LinkedQueue<Student> waitlist
      The waitlist LinkedQueue of Students. If a student tries to enroll into a full roll, they are placed in the waitlist queue.

    • CourseRoll

      public CourseRoll(int enrollmentCap, Course c)
      Constructs a CourseRoll with the given enrollment capacity
      Parameters:
      enrollmentCap - The enrollment capacity to assign this roll.
      c - the course to set
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the enrollment capacity is invalid.

  • Method Details

    • getEnrollmentCap

      public int getEnrollmentCap()
      Returns the enrollment capacity of this CourseRoll.
      Returns:
      The enrollment capacity.

    • setEnrollmentCap

      public void setEnrollmentCap(int newEnrollmentCap)
      Sets the enrollment cap to the given number. If the number is above or below the allowed bounds of a Course, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      newEnrollmentCap - the enrollment capacity to set.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If it is set to be less than 10, greater than 250, or less than the size of the roll.

    • enroll

      public void enroll(Student newStudent)
      Enrolls the given Student into the CourseRoll and adds them to the list. If the CourseRoll has reached capacity, the Student should be added to the waitlist. That is one reason why roll.add(s) (which is really a call to LinkedAbstractList.add()) might throw an IllegalArgumentException. If the size of the roll is the same as enrollmentCap attempt to add the student to waitlist. If the waitlist is full, then the Student cannot enroll and an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      newStudent - The Student to Enroll
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the Student is invalid or cannot be enrolled.

    • drop

      public void drop(Student newStudent)
      Removes the student from the roll. If the Student is in the main roll, remove the Student and add the first eligible Student in the waitlist to the main roll. If the Student is in the waitlist, remove the Student from the waitlist while maintaining the order of the waitlist and working with the specialized data structure methods.
      Parameters:
      newStudent - The student to remove from the roll.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the student is null or cannot be removed.

    • getOpenSeats

      public int getOpenSeats()
      Returns the number of open seats in the class.
      Returns:
      The number of open seats in the class.

    • canEnroll

      public boolean canEnroll(Student newStudent)
      Returns false if the student is already in the class or the class is full.
      Parameters:
      newStudent - The Student to check for enrollment with.
      Returns:
      False if the student cannot enroll, true if the student can.
